instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Ram chip replacement
threads.message:
I have this board that i believe needs it's ram chips changed. I'm getting error PPM003/004 which points to an issue with the memory. I've checked for corrosion and found none. 

As this my first ever ram replacement, my question, does it matter if the chip i used is of a different manufacturer but from the same donor board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)? The board needing fixed has chips from Skhynix but my donor boards has something else, which doesn't have a manufacturer name, just a pn, SEC740. Both the donor board and the board needing repairs are 8Gb boards. Only difference is the CPU, the board needing repairs is a 2.2GHz while the donor is a 1.8GhZ.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Ram chip replacement
threads.message: It's fine but you also have to match the RAMCFG strapping resistors with the donor board. Check if <RESISTOR>R1631</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R1636</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R1635</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R1611</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R2050</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R2051</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R2052</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R2053</RESISTOR> are populated or not on the donor board and replicate on the recipient board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Ram chip replacement
threads.message: Thanks a lot. That worked perfectly. Is there a link to a document that list all the resistors, like you did, for all model boars (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - all years, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - all years, and so on)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Ram chip replacement
threads.message: As far as I know they all have the RAMCFG annotation, the schematics list some configurations but I'm not sure if they are 100% accurate.
